title: Gravitational energy - satellite in two o

content.description: While a satellite orbits the Earth at a constant distance of one Earth radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"> <mi>R</mi> </math> above Earth’s surface, the total energy of the satellite-Earth system is <math alttext="E sub R" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math>. When the satellite is moved to a circular orbit a distance <math alttext="3 R" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></math> above Earth’s surface, the satellite-Earth system has a total energy <math alttext="E sub 3 R, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>.
content.question: Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="E sub 3 R, end sub" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> to <math alttext="E sub R" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub, equals one third times E sub uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub, equals one half times E sub uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub, equals two times E sub uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub, equals 3 times E sub uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>
